sentences.en: ...their boorish rejection of the aging film star.
sentences.cn: …他们对这老影星粗鲁的拒绝。

sentences.en: At time he was almost seductively charming; at other times he was boorish and obtuse.
sentences.cn: 他有时几乎表现得妩媚动人, 有时却土里土气象个十足的笨伯.

sentences.en: Churlish: like, or befitting a churl ; boorish or vulgar.
sentences.cn: 象或适合粗鲁人的; 粗鲁的或庸俗的.

sentences.en: He disgusted many with his boorish behaviour.
sentences.cn: 他的粗野行为让很多人都讨厌他。

sentences.en: He is boorish and rash , so he always brings trouble to his family.
sentences.cn: 他性格粗莽, 经常给家里惹祸.
他的举止看上去很俗气.

sentences.en: I had a sensitive consciousness of always appearing constrained, boorish, and dull.
sentences.cn: 我深切地感觉到自己束手束脚, 笨手笨脚,呆呆板板, 怔怔傻傻.

sentences.en: Maybe they were being pushy, that's still no excuse for his childish, boorish behaviour.
sentences.cn: 也许他们极具进取心, 但这也不是他行为孩子气和粗鄙的借口.

sentences.en: Not the assiduous life is a crime, the non - technique industrious is boorish.
sentences.cn: 不勤勉的人生便是罪过, 无技艺的勤劳就是粗野.

sentences.en: Patrick's boorish rudeness soon drove Monica's friends away.
sentences.cn: 帕特里克的粗鲁无礼很快使得莫妮卡的朋友们想走了。

sentences.en: That is indeed boorish and not the behaviour of our readers.
sentences.cn: 那样做实在很粗野,不是我们的读者所应为.

sentences.en: Though the man I introduced to you last night looks somewhat boorish, he is a diamond in the rough.
sentences.cn: 我昨天晚上介绍给你认识的那个人虽然看上去有点没礼貌, 可他是个外粗内秀的人.

words.tran_cn: 农民；粗野的人；不懂礼貌的人
粗野的；粗鲁的；粗鄙的；笨拙的；乡土气的

trans.tran_cn: 粗野的，粗鲁的，笨拙的，乡巴佬的
trans.tran_en: Boorish behaviour is rough, uneducated, and rude
